content: The original game was difficult enough. Screen controls are useless for this type of platformer. Please add controller support and I'll give you five stars.
The best 80'$ Game ever

No controller support and awful screen controls. If the screen touchpad was good it would be fine, but everything is a separate button. Jump and climb should be the same, down should be on a d pad. I wish i could get a refund, but at least it is classic/true to original. 2 stars because it plays how i remember.
A excellent game I remember this game when I was a kid and I still like it now.
Runs well a great classic
Great but hard.
Excellent!
It good, it hard like original, but most importantly it fun. Only issue always have to change controls because they auto reset
Loved original years ago. Had this on commodore 64. Bit too easy to die and not any lives so constantly have to start it over but controls easy to use and gameplay a good representation of original
Love the game, but the controls are aweful
Great but last level can't get ahold to beat

content: Don't buy this game, the controls are as bad as they say.
The game good and easy but the controler is triky
Good port! well made controls for touch screen

Loved this game when I was a kid. Great port it's no different from the classic arcade version. I almost beat the nes version in the early 90s. But I belive they made the NES version a little easier. As this and Battle Toads are considered to be the hardest games made.
No good my controller doesn't work with this, unplayable with controls as is.
So close to being a perfect mobile port... just wish there was controller support and maybe you could move the screen a little more to the left and rotate the other way
Controls could be a little better. But still a really good game.
The best what a throw back... Just like when i usto go to the arcade... Awesome... love it
I can never find The shield but still good game
Good classic arcade
Accurate port but not mobile friendly. The developer didn't really put much consideration into making the controls friendly to mobile play. It's basically the original game shoved in a box.
Albselutly great one of my retro favourites

Great game! Controls are tricky. My bluetooth 8bitdo SF30 Pro Gamepad works with most of my other games but not this one. Please add input device/controller compatibilty. Will make it so much better to play. Please resolve for more stars. Cheers. 游땔游

Great game, however, I'm pretty sure there's a bug.. half of the screen is blacked out! When I go from base level to one higher the screen doesn't pan up with the sprite!! Im so conflicted because it does play well, but I spent my hard earned money on something that, unfortunately, can't be played right.:/
Great throwback!! Enjoying the fun all over again.
Gamepad support.... Gamepad support.... Gamepad support.... Gamepad support.... 5 stars once you offer a way to play that is infact retro....
Not compatible with latest android versions
Blast from the past

Unlike other classic 8-bit and 16-bit games ported to mobile devices this game is actually fair and plays very similar to the original game. The controls do not get stiff. I never finished this game in my youth, but with the advent of mobile gaming I was finally able to finish this game.
Bad controller option on android
played this game alot coin op... all the secrets items aren't there anymore..what the deal..

I got bit by the nostalgia bug and bought it immediately. While the emulation seems perfect, there doesn't seem to be support for a bluetooth controller. I won't refund since i bought my NES copy second hand. I'd love to give my money directly to a developer but this needs controller support.

Great game with achievements and leaderboards. But the developers lie with wrong screenshots of the d-pad and jump buttons. The layout is a joke. You need to duck often and instead of pressing down there is a seperate button which is slightly off to the side. Same with climbing ladders. Game is timeless and an all time great. Just a shame they cant get a dpad right.
Can't see top half of screen. Ever. How can i play the game like this?

Ten points to the developer. Identical to the arcade version almost 3 decades ago. The buttons/ control panel getting use to but other than that wow. What memories it brings. My two favourite arcade games ever were Rygar and Ghost 'n Goblins. Worth it's salt!
My small age favourite game
Should have controller support...

Terrible. The screen is totally blocked by the controls so you can't see what's happening in a lot of the gameplay area. And it never remembers your preferences, so you have to enter them all again at the start of every game! Don't bother with this. Waste of time and money.

Not too bad of a nap but I don't give a full starts cuz I hit the controls inthis game not to mention I do not like how I could not hook up Bluetooth controller up to it which is the way I prefer to play my games on my phone but I had no choice but to use the controller that I already did not like on the screen

Don't get me wrong, I love this game. I give it one star because the touch controls are badly implemented and the game crashed 3 times within a matter of minutes. I would love to be able to play this game on my phone, but this app is unplayable in it's current state. At least it's on the Switch. Refunded immediately.

Just keep in mind your buying one of the hardest games ever made on Nintendo and your going to be playing touch screen controls . That means it's going to be close to impossible to beat this game. My reason for not leaving a 5 star review is that my virtual pad controls selection from the pause menu resets to Type A controls everytime I get game over. So everytime I start a new game I gotta always go and switch the controls back to virtual pad control. Not a big deal but a little annoying.
The game is ok. My only problem is the controls. The controls suck really bad on here!
Terrible controls.
it's awesome, and extremely difficult. My only complaint is that there is no volume setting. Other than that, really cool.
bad control

lol all these people complaining about difficulty it's like they've never played a capcom game XD....Excellent port controls are fine and the addition of casual mode is good for newcomers and the nostalgia is far worth the price!

Just how i remember it but it's pretty difficult using the touch controls, is there support for a joypad? Last time i tried i could only jump and fire so useless. Need full support for me to enjoy it properly

My favourite arcade game from the 80s. This is the first decent version I've seen since. The catch is the controls are dodgy; eg. there is a left and a right arrow for direction but the left and half the right arrow move left and only half the right arrow moves to the right. It gets more of a problem the further you get. Also too much lag especially on jump. The jump and fire controls obscure part of the right side of the game screen but this is a platform game so you can't see what's coming.
no deja avanzar mas haya de la primera llave
well its a gpod port and game itself, but i when i climb something the top half of my screen goes black which makes the game impossible to play... fix or refund please. thanks

I've played this on a Samsung J3 Mission. The game played well for the first week I've owned it, but now the emulation cuts off half of the screen horizontally. I love the game but I've found no way around this glitch. I cannot recreate the conditions because I have no idea what happened. I have uninstalled/reinstalled the game but the glitch remains. 4 stars due to this glitch.
awesome! arcade accurate!

i just downloaded it since a couple of days, arrived at the 2nd stage bossses, amazing game it's just the original version, and i find controls quite good, honestly i don't understand the bad reviews, higly recommended for those who loved this game at the time. Classic 5 stars

I downloaded G & G and was instantly transported to my local bowling alley, 16 years old, punching the hell out of the buttons as I spent night after night, dollar after dollar, conquering this game. The opportunity to relive those times, MANY years later, on an app that is virtually identical to that original console, is hugely exciting! Thank you very much! :)
Loved it in the ARCADE & I STILL love it. WHY "isn't" this game available FOR PS4 ??!!!!
As difficult to play as ever. even more so on a phone.
controls were okay, kept crashing constantly. crashed when i dies or completed a level
I remember play this Arcade when i little. I like this game it a good classic Arcade.

Too hard! What the heck? And kids played this back in the day? I'm in my twenties and I can't even get past the very beginning of the game! Boo!
Classic g&g! Love it!
The best classic game series ever created as well as one of the most difficult games! The controls are very good on this app, and the gameplay is legit as always! Thank you Capcom!

This is an awesome game but.... The controls are f**king terrible. When you continue it resets the controls to standard. In virtual pad mode, which is the only way to play properly, jump and shoot buttons are way too big and the pad control buttons are too small, the pad is half way up the screen so it's too high. Make it so the game pad is customisable and can be saved. Then it's 5 star. As it is, once I hit the castle it's unplayable. I was a master of this arcade game in the 80s. I could clock through 3 times on a single game. I know what I'm talking about.

Screen is off center. Controller buttons need to be adjustable as far too big. Controls need resetting every time you quit the game. Please fix these issues :"((( Also if you could release sf2 champion edition and sf2 hyper fighting that would be a great addition to your android selection.
Sometimes you gotta tap the screen more than once to do what you want and all in all it's a fast pace game and that hurts especially in a crucial moment
Just like when I was a kid. The controls need to fixed y'all
Whoop whoop!
Just like the arcade version, thank you

What this and every other arcade conversion needs is SCANLINES. Otherwise, 
the graphics become quite unappealing and it greatly detracts from the 
experience. Scanline emulation on non-CRT displays is perfectly feasible 
(check MAME emulator), it massively improves the graphics, and it gives the 
proper retro feel and authenticity that games like this deserve.

Fix the UP and DOWN keys, they are in a horrible position, too far up and 
too far down from the side keys. Same goes with the ATTACK and JUMP keys. 
Fix this issue and ill give it 5 stars
Bluetooth controller support need to make this game playable for me.

The savegame/continue does not save weapons acquired - this means you 
cannot keep the shield you need to win the game on the last level.
Awesome game get it if you can

and the graphics were better than I remember. But the game is an entire 
glitch fest! While casually playing I was hopping through walls, going 
right through enemies, and even de-spawning enemies. I love the game but 
maybe fix some glitches?

It was very fun, and I love the classic life style of only 3 lives

I would have given this fives across the board if it weren't for the tough controllers and the fact that I can't beat the end guy. I truly believe they designed this app so that you cannot beat the game.

I used to play this game in the videogame arcades as a kid. I am completely blown away with how true to the arcade game it is. I recommend this game to all fans of ghosts n goblins. The best arcade game i have ever played on my phone.
Pretty good retro game I love this game had to buy it :)
I would give it 5 instead of 3 stars if it had controller (moga) support. Without that, it is not so much fun, control is too unprecise, error-prone and slow for such a demanding game.

I was so happy to see this. As a teenager I wasted probably too much time playing this. However, the original bugs are not present in this port which is a big shame. I'm talking about the infinite time bug and the dragon at the end of the fire bridge in particular.

This game used to be fun, but whenever I play it on my Samsung galaxy s3 it has a bunch of flashing colors for backgrounds instead of what I see on the pictures. The same thing happens with 1942. It almost makes this game unplayable,  but its completely unplayable with 1942. Please fix this.

Great game, an all time classic. But the fact that you can't select your control scheme before starting the game or have it save your control preferences for the next time you play is a major issue. The moment the game starts you're in danger, so it's pretty difficult to find a point where you can pause, change it, and then not be immediately attacked when you resume the game.

I'm a huge fan of classic Capcom arcade games, and Ghosts N Goblins is one of the greats. It's a perfect re-creation graphics and sound wise, and the controls are much better than I expected. A lot of these games are just to frustrating to play using touchscreen based controls, but Capcom has figured it out pretty well here. This thing is definitely playable!
Awesome, Flash back to 89/90

One of my favorite Capcom games. Must have controller controls. Button controls in game are poor.

Change the control layout first thing you do. Big time nostalgia after that.
replyContent: I'm sorry you're having issues with the controls.  If you hit the pause button in the upper right hand corner during gameplay you will be taken to the settings menu. From there you can choose between four different button layouts.

content: No bluetooth controller support. C'mon capcom this is emulation 101 these days. Your old games arent exactly casual so you need to support proper controls. A CRT filer would also be nice. This game is a classic but unplayable to me at the moment.
Pretty good there are lots of control options in the pause menu..love to see more classics from Capcom
Was looking fwd to this. but the absence of BT controller support is a BIG disappointment.  The game is unplayable w/ onscreen buttons. Please add BT controller support!  ThX
replyContent: I'm sorry you're having issues with the default controls.  If you hit the pause button in the upper right hand corner during gameplay you will be taken to the settings menu. From there you can choose between four different button layouts.

content: Controls just need a little bit of practice that's all, I have got to the end of the 1st level so far.this game is over 30 years old it is meant to be hard they don't make them like this anymore.keep them coming capcom
In short term, if not because I grew up playing this game, I will not purchase it.
Awesome. Is this like the oldest zombie game ever created or something? Has to be.
No BT controller support and on screen buttons are terrible.

Truly awful controls. The game is difficult enough already without giving the game awful controls. the buttons are so huge on the Galaxy S7 that you have to stretch to reach jump and fire. One option only shows the up and down buttons (which take up literally half the screen) and no left and right buttons. I should not need to stretch to reach controls on a phone screen. the game does not even remember the control layout you selected when you leave and reload the game. Make the controls moveable and resizable and remembered when you leave and exit the game, and then it would be worth rating, until then you have made a difficult game near on impossible to play, at least my galaxy S7, which is not an uncommon phone or uses an unusual screen resolution. Until the controls are resolved I would find this difficult to recommend to anyone.
Capcom do it again!!! Controls are terrible, i can't imagine who's the one behind testing the game before you releasing it, you just don't learn from megaman. I'm really disappointed... again.
replyContent: I'm sorry you're having issues with the controls.  If you hit the pause button in the upper right hand corner during gameplay you will be taken to the settings menu. From there you can choose between four different button layouts.

content: Nightmare, the screen flashes blue and pink non stop. NOT playable.

Controls are terrible. Huge oversized buttons. Even worse is the fact that your choice of controls from the limited selection  is not saved, so each time you begin it goes back to the default setting.  Gameplay and graphics are true to the 80's classic, but you'll be doing well to get through the first level before frustration sets in due to the insane difficulty in manoeuvring. Please add better control options Capcom.
Doesn't save the controller layout, needs audio volume control.
Meh, it's a good port.
